summary: An FBI 302 report documenting an interview conducted on August 16, 2019, with an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) regarding the inmate's observations of Jeffrey Epstein's routine and the inmate's own movements prior to Epstein's death. The inmate provided no information regarding Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate at MCC whose routine and cell location are described by the witness. He was housed in cell 220 on L-TIER and would be in 'legal' from approximately 9am to 9pm.

events.title: Inmate Visit and Contraband Suspicion
events.description: The witness inmate received a visit from his girlfriend at MCC, was suspected of receiving contraband, and was placed in a 'dry room' for approximately 25 hours before being moved to a different cell.

events.title: FBI Interview of Inmate
events.description: FBI agents interviewed an inmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center regarding his observations and any information about the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), 150 Park Row, New York, NY
New York, New York, United States
keyFacts: An inmate witness was interviewed by the FBI on August 16, 2019, regarding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The witness stated he had no information regarding Epstein's death.
The witness described Epstein's routine in MCC: housed in cell 220 on L-TIER and would be in 'legal' from approximately 9am to 9pm.
The witness's own movements were detailed: he was moved from cell 218 to a 'dry room' and then to cell 111 after a visit from his girlfriend on August 9, 2019.
The document is an official FBI 302 report, indicating it is a record of an interview and contains neither recommendations nor conclusions.
